      • revokeAccessTokens

        public void revokeAccessTokens(String[] tokens)
                        throws IdentityOAuth2Exception
        This method is to revoke specific tokens where tokens should be plain text tokens.
        Specified by:
        revokeAccessTokens in interface AccessTokenDAO
        Parameters:
        tokens - tokens that needs to be revoked
        Throws:
        IdentityOAuth2Exception - if failed to revoke the access token

      • revokeAccessTokens

        public void revokeAccessTokens(String[] tokens,
                               boolean isHashedToken)
                        throws IdentityOAuth2Exception
        This method is to revoke specific tokens where tokens can be plain text tokens or hashed tokens. Hashed tokens can be reached here from internal calls such as from any listeners ex: IdentityOathEventListener etc. We need to differentiate this types of internal calls hence these calls retrieved the tokens from the DB and then try to revoke it. When the Token Hashing Feature enabled, the token which is retrieve from the DB will be a hashed token. Hence we don't need to hash it again.
        Specified by:
        revokeAccessTokens in interface AccessTokenDAO
        Parameters:
        tokens - Tokens that needs to be revoked.
        isHashedToken - Indicate provided token is a hashed token or plain text token.
        Throws:
        IdentityOAuth2Exception - if failed to revoke the access token

      • revokeAccessTokensInBatch

        public void revokeAccessTokensInBatch(String[] tokens)
                               throws IdentityOAuth2Exception
        Revoke the access token(s) as a batch. Token(s) which is reached here will be a plain text tokens.
        Specified by:

      • getAccessTokensByUser

        public Set<String> getAccessTokensByUser(org.wso2.carbon.identity.application.authentication.framework.model.AuthenticatedUser authenticatedUser)
                                  throws IdentityOAuth2Exception
        Returns the set of access tokens issued for the user. The returned set of access tokens is consumed by IdentityOathEventListener to clear user claims cached against the tokens during a user attribute update. Unless id_token are issued for client_credentials grants there is no point in returning tokens issued with type APPLICATION since no claims are usually cached against tokens issued for client_credentials. Tokens with type APPLICATION can be associated with a particular user, if he/she is the owner of the app.
        Specified by:
        getAccessTokensByUser in interface AccessTokenDAO
        Parameters:
        authenticatedUser -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        IdentityOAuth2Exception

      • invalidateAndCreateNewAccessToken

        public void invalidateAndCreateNewAccessToken(String oldAccessTokenId,
                                              String tokenState,
                                              String consumerKey,
                                              String tokenStateId,
                                              AccessTokenDO accessTokenDO,
                                              String userStoreDomain)
                                       throws IdentityOAuth2Exception
        This method is used invalidate the existing token and generate a new toke within one DB transaction.
        Specified by:
        invalidateAndCreateNewAccessToken in interface AccessTokenDAO
        Parameters:
        oldAccessTokenId - access token need to be updated.
        tokenState - token state before generating new token.
        consumerKey - consumer key of the existing token
        tokenStateId - new token state id to be updated
        accessTokenDO - new access token details
        userStoreDomain - user store domain which is related to this consumer
        Throws:
        IdentityOAuth2Exception
